us.phonetic: /v. ˈprɛdɪˌkeɪt; adj., n. -kɪt/, (v. pred′i kāt′; adj., n. pred′i kit)

example.eg: The priest predicated the goodness of all mankind in his touching sermon.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 断定, 断言, 判定

example.eg: I predicated my arguments on statistical evidence and facts.
The predicate is the part of a sentence that includes the verb and says something about the subject.
